MajorClaims.MC1: my term of a successful man is one who has certain achievements in life rather than the one with a high income
MajorClaims.MC2: using only money as a scale to measure a man's success is impossible

Claims.C1: it is the essential in basic needs
Claims.C2: a man can only achieve his accomplishment through hard-working, dedication and passion
Claims.C3: judging a person by his income is difficult, especially in the success aspect

Premises.P1: A person's great prosperity does not state that he has gained it ethically by himself
Premises.P3: ways of earning it is also various
Premises.P4: Whether it is a personal or a social achievement, that man is laudable
Premises.P5: the more beneficial for the society his achievement is, the more successful he is considered
Premises.P6: Thomas Edison is undeniably considered as one of the greatest inventors in the 20th century
Premises.P7: his invention's productivity is countless useful for mankind
Premises.P8: the fact of knowing a man's utilization of his money remains in the dark
